member.summary: View in the MTConnect Model browser model.mtconnect.org

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.DataItemTypes.EndOfBarSubTypes.PRIMARY
member.summary: specific applications MAY reference one or more locations on a piece of bar stock as the indication for the EndOfBar. The main or most important location MUST be designated as the PRIMARY indication for the EndOfBar. If no subType is specified, PRIMARY MUST be the default EndOfBar indication.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.DataItemTypes.EndOfBarSubTypes.AUXILIARY
member.summary: when multiple locations on a piece of bar stock are referenced as the indication for the EndOfBar, the additional location(s) MUST be designated as AUXILIARY indication(s) for the EndOfBar.

member.name: T:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.DataItemTypes.EquipmentModeSubTypes
member.summary: View in the MTConnect Model browser model.mtconnect.org

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.DataItemTypes.EquipmentModeSubTypes.LOADED
member.summary: indication that the sub-parts of a piece of equipment are under load. Example: For traditional machine tools, this is an indication that the cutting tool is assumed to be engaged with the part.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.DataItemTypes.EquipmentModeSubTypes.WORKING
member.summary: indication that a piece of equipment is performing any activity, the equipment is active and performing a function under load or not. Example: For traditional machine tools, this includes when the piece of equipment is LOADED, making rapid moves, executing a tool change, etc.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.DataItemTypes.EquipmentModeSubTypes.OPERATING
member.summary: indication that the major sub-parts of a piece of equipment are powered or performing any activity whether producing a part or product or not. Example: For traditional machine tools, this includes when the piece of equipment is WORKING or it is idle.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.DataItemTypes.EquipmentModeSubTypes.POWERED
member.summary: indication that primary power is applied to the piece of equipment and, as a minimum, the controller or logic portion of the piece of equipment is powered and functioning or components that are required to remain on are powered. Example: Heaters for an extrusion machine that required to be powered even when the equipment is turned off.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.DataItemTypes.EquipmentModeSubTypes.DELAY
member.summary: elapsed time of a temporary halt of action.

member.name: T:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.DataItemTypes.EquipmentTimerSubTypes
member.summary: View in the MTConnect Model browser model.mtconnect.org

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.DataItemTypes.EquipmentTimerSubTypes.LOADED
member.summary: time that the sub-parts of a piece of equipment are under load. Example: For traditional machine tools, this is a measurement of the time that the cutting tool is assumed to be engaged with the part.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.DataItemTypes.EquipmentTimerSubTypes.WORKING
member.summary: time that a piece of equipment is performing any activity the equipment is active and performing a function under load or not. Example: For traditional machine tools, this includes LOADED, plus rapid moves, tool changes, etc.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.DataItemTypes.EquipmentTimerSubTypes.OPERATING
member.summary: time that the major sub-parts of a piece of equipment are powered or performing any activity whether producing a part or product or not. Example: For traditional machine tools, this includes WORKING, plus idle time.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.DataItemTypes.EquipmentTimerSubTypes.POWERED
member.summary: time that primary power is applied to the piece of equipment and, as a minimum, the controller or logic portion of the piece of equipment is powered and functioning or components that are required to remain on are powered. Example: Heaters for an extrusion machine that are required to be powered even when the equipment is turned off.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.DataItemTypes.EquipmentTimerSubTypes.DELAY
member.summary: elapsed time of a temporary halt of action.

member.summary: set of axes currently associated with a Path or Controller.

member.summary: operational state of an apparatus for moving or controlling a mechanism or system.

member.summary: assetId of the Asset that has been removed.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.AXIS_COUPLING
member.summary: describes the way the axes will be associated to each other. This is used in conjunction with COUPLED_AXES to indicate the way they are interacting.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.AXIS_INTERLOCK
member.summary: state of the axis lockout function when power has been removed and the axis is allowed to move freely.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.AXIS_STATE
member.summary: state of a Linear or Rotary component representing an axis.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.DataItemTypes.EventTypes.CHUCK_INTERLOCK
member.summary: state of an interlock function or control logic state intended to prevent the associated Chuck component from being operated.

member.name: T:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.DeviceRelationshipRoleTypes
member.summary: Available options for a

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.DeviceRelationshipRoleTypes.SYSTEM
member.summary: The associated piece of equipment performs the functions of a System for this piece of equipment. In MTConnect, System provides utility type services to support the operation of a piece of equipment and these services are required for the operation of a piece of equipment.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.DeviceRelationshipRoleTypes.AUXILIARY
member.summary: The associated piece of equipment performs the functions as an Auxiliary for this piece of equipment. In MTConnect, Auxiliary extends the capabilities of a piece of equipment, but is not required for the equipment to function.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.AlarmLimitElements.UPPER_LIMIT
member.summary: The upper conformance boundary for a variable.

member.summary: The upper boundary indicating increased concern and supervision may be required.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.AlarmLimitElements.LOWER_WARNING
member.summary: The lower boundary indicating increased concern and supervision may be required.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.AlarmLimitElements.LOWER_LIMIT
member.summary: The lower conformance boundary for a variable.

member.name: T:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.ChannelElements
member.summary: Channel represents each sensing element connected to a sensor unit.
member.remarks: See Part 2 Section 9.1.3.1.2 of the MTConnect specification.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.ChannelElements.DESCRIPTION
member.summary: An XML element that can contain any descriptive content. The CDATA of Description MAY include any additional descriptive information the implementer chooses to include regarding a sensor element.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.ChannelElements.CALIBRATION_DATE
member.summary: Date upon which the sensor unit was last calibrated to the sensor element. The data value for CalibrationDate is provided in the CDATA for this element and MUST be represented in the W3C ISO 8601 format.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.ChannelElements.NEXT_CALIBRATION_DATE
member.summary: Date upon which the sensor element is next scheduled to be calibrated with the sensor unit. The data value for NextCalibrationDate is provided in the CDATA for this element and MUST be represented in the W3C ISO 8601 format.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.ChannelElements.CALIBRATION_INITIALS
member.summary: The initials of the person verifying the validity of the calibration data. The data value for CalibrationInitials is provided in the CDATA for this element and MAY be any numeric or text content.

member.name: T:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.ComponentConfigurationElements
member.summary: Configuration contains technical information about a component describing its physical layout, functional characteristics, and relationships with other components within a piece of equipment.
member.remarks: See Part 2 Section 9 of the MTConnect specification

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.ComponentConfigurationElements.COORDINATE_SYSTEMS
member.summary: CoordinateSystems aggregates CoordinateSystem configurations for a Component.
member.remarks: See Part 2 Section 9.4 of the MTConnect specification

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.ComponentConfigurationElements.COORDINATE_SYSTEM
member.summary: A CoordinateSystem is a reference system that associates a unique set of n parameters with each point in an n-dimensional space. Ref: ISO 10303-218:2004
member.remarks: See Part 2 Section 9.4.1 of the MTConnect specification

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.ComponentConfigurationElements.MOTION
member.summary: Motion defines the movement of the Component relative to a coordinate system.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.ComponentConfigurationElements.RELATIONSHIPS
member.summary: Relationships is an XML container that organizes information defining the associ ation between pieces of equipment that function independently but together perform a manufacturing operation. Relationships may also define the association between components within a piece of equipment.
member.remarks: See Part 2 Section 9.2 of the MTConnect specification

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.ComponentConfigurationElements.DEVICE_RELATIONSHIP
member.summary: DeviceRelationship describes the association between two pieces of equipment that function independently but together perform a manufacturing operation.
member.remarks: See Part 2 Section 9.2.1.1 of the MTConnect specification

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.ComponentConfigurationElements.COMPONENT_RELATIONSHIP
member.summary: ComponentRelationship describes the association between two components within a piece of equipment that function independently but together perform a capability or service within a piece of equipment.
member.remarks: See Part 2 Section 9.2.1.2 of the MTConnect specification

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.ComponentConfigurationElements.SENSOR_CONFIGURATION
member.summary: An element that can contain descriptive content defining the configuration information for Sensor.
member.remarks: See Part 2 Section 9.1.3 of the MTConnect specification

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.ComponentConfigurationElements.SOLID_MODEL
member.summary: SolidModel references a file with the three-dimensional geometry of the Component or Composition.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.ComponentConfigurationElements.SPECIFICATIONS
member.summary: Specifications is an XML container in the Configuration of a Component that contains one or more Specification elements describing the design characteristics for a piece of equipment.
member.remarks: See Part 2 Section 9.3 of the MTConnect specification

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.ComponentConfigurationElements.SPECIFICATION
member.summary: Specification elements define information describing the design characteristics for a piece of equipment.
member.remarks: See Part 2 Section 9.3.1 of the MTConnect specification

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.ComponentElements.CONFIGURATION
member.summary: An XML element that contains technical information about a piece of equipment describing its physical layout or functional characteristics.

member.summary: A container for the Data Entities (See ) associated with this Component element.

member.summary: See .

member.summary: Description can contain any descriptive content for this Composition element.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.ControlLimitElements.UPPER_LIMIT
member.summary: The upper conformance boundary for a variable.

member.summary: The upper boundary indicating increased concern and supervision may be required.

member.summary: Elements for the CoordinateSystem element in the MTConnect Response Document.
member.remarks: See Part 2 Section 9.4.1.2 of the MTConnect specification

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.CoordinateSystemElements.ORIGIN
member.summary: The coordinates of the origin position of a coordinate system. The coordinate MUST be in MILLIMETER_3D.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.CoordinateSystemElements.TRANSFORMATION
member.summary: The process of transforming to the origin position of the coordinate system from a parent coordinate system using Translation and Rotation.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.CoordinateSystemElements.DESCRIPTION
member.summary: natural language description of the CoordinateSystem.

member.name: T:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.DataItemElements
member.summary: Available elements for the element

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.DataItemElements.SOURCE
member.summary: Source is an optional XML element that identifies the Component, DataItem, or Composition representing the area of the piece of equipment from which a measured value originates. Additionally, Source MAY provide information relating to the identity of a measured value. This information is reported as CDATA for Source. (example, a PLC tag)

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.DataItemElements.CONSTRAINTS
member.summary: Constraints is an optional container that provides a set of expected values that can be reported for this DataItem. Constraints are used by a software application to evaluate the validity of the reported data.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.DataItemElements.FILTERS
member.summary: An optional container for the Filter elements associated with this DataItem element.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.DataItemElements.INITIAL_VALUE
member.summary: InitialValue is an optional XML element that defines the starting value for a data item as well as the value to be set for the data item after a reset event. Only one InitialValue element may be defined for a data item. The value will be constant and cannot change. If no InitialValue element is defined for a data item that is periodically reset, then the starting value for the data item MUST be a value of 0.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.DataItemElements.RESET_TRIGGER
member.summary: ResetTrigger is an optional XML element that identifies the type of event that may cause a reset to occur. It is additional information regarding the meaning of the data that establishes an understanding of the time frame that the data represents so that the data may be correctly understood by a client software application.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.DataItemElements.DEFINITION
member.summary: The Definition defines the meaning of Entry and Cell elements associated with the DataItem when the representation is either DATA_SET or TABLE.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.MotionElements.DESCRIPTION
member.summary: An element that can contain any descriptive content.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.MotionElements.AXIS
member.summary: Axis defines the axis along or around which the COmponent moves relative to a coordinate system.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.MotionElements.ORIGIN
member.summary: A fixed point from which measurement or motion commences.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.MotionElements.TRANSFORMATION
member.summary: The Transformation of the parent Origin or Transformation using Translation and Rotation.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.ProcessSpecificationElements.CONTROL_LIMITS
member.summary: A set of limits used to indicate whether a process variable is stable and in control.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.ProcessSpecificationElements.SPECIFICATION_LIMITS
member.summary: A set of limits defining a range of values designating acceptable performance for a variable.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.ProcessSpecificationElements.ALARM_LIMITS
member.summary: A set of limits used to trigger warning or alarm indicators.

member.name: T:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.SensorConfigurationElements
member.summary: An element that can contain descriptive content defining the configuration information for Sensor. For Sensor, the valid configuration is SensorConfiguration which provides data from a subset of items commonly found in a transducer electronic data sheet for sensors and actuators called TEDS. TEDS formats are defined in IEEE 1451.0 and 1451.4 transducer interface standards (ref 15 and 16, respectively). MTConnect does not support all of the data represented in the TEDS data, nor does it duplicate the function of the TEDS data sheets.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.SensorConfigurationElements.FIRMWARE_VERSION
member.summary: Version number for the sensor unit as specified by the manufacturer.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.SensorConfigurationElements.CALIBRATION_DATE
member.summary: Date upon which the sensor unit was last calibrated.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.SensorConfigurationElements.NEXT_CALIBRATION_DATE
member.summary: Date upon which the sensor unit is next scheduled to be calibrated.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.SensorConfigurationElements.CALIBRATION_INITIALS
member.summary: The initials of the person verifying the validity of the calibration data.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.SensorConfigurationElements.CHANNELS
member.summary: When Sensor represents multiple sensing elements, each sensing element is represented by a Channel for the Sensor.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.SensorConfigurationElements.CHANNEL
member.summary: Channel represents each sensing element connected to a sensor unit.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.SolidModelElements.TRANSFORMATION
member.summary: The translation of the origin to the position and orientation.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.SolidModelElements.SCALE
member.summary: The SolidModel Scale is either a single multiplier applied to all three dimensions or a three space multiplier given in the X, Y, and Z dimensions in the coordinate system used for the SolidModel.

member.name: T:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.SpecificationElements
member.summary: Elements within the Specification element in the MTConnect Response document.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.SpecificationElements.MAXIMUM
member.summary: A numeric upper limit constraint.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.SpecificationElements.MINIMUM
member.summary: A numeric lower limit constraint.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.SpecificationElements.NOMINAL
member.summary: The numeric target or expected value.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.SpecificationLimitElements.UPPER_LIMIT
member.summary: The upper conformance boundary for a variable.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.SpecificationLimitElements.NOMINAL
member.summary: The ideal or desired value for a variable.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.SpecificationLimitElements.LOWER_LIMIT
member.summary: The lower conformance boundary for a variable.

member.name: T:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.TransformationElements
member.summary: Elements for a Transformation element in the MTConnect Response Document.
member.remarks: See Part 2 Section 9.4.1.2.1 of the MTConnect specification

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.TransformationElements.TRANSLATION
member.summary: Translations along X, Y, and Z axes are expressed as x, y, and z respectively within a 3-dimensional vector. The values MUST be given in MILLIMETER_3D.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.Elements.TransformationElements.ROTATION
member.summary: Rotations about X, Y, and Z axes are expressed in A, B, and C respectively within a 3-dimensional vector. The values MUST be given in DEGREE_3D. Positive A, B, and C are in the directions to advance right-hand screws in the positive X, Y, and Z directions, respectively. Ref:ISO 9787:2013

member.summary: Available options for a representation attribute on a

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.RepresentationTypes.DATA_SET
member.summary: The reported value(s) are represented as a set of key-value pairs. Each reported value in the Data Set MUST have a unique key.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.RepresentationTypes.VALUE
member.summary: The measured value of a sample. If no representation is specified for a DataItem, the representation MUST be determined to be VALUE.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.RepresentationTypes.TABLE
member.summary: A Table is a two dimensional set of key-value pairs where the Entry represents a row, and the value is a set of key-value pair Cell elements. The Table follows the same behavior as the Data Set for change tracking, clearing, and history. When an Entry changes, all Cell elements update as a single unit following the behavior of a Data Set.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.RepresentationTypes.TIME_SERIES
member.summary: A series of sampled data. The data is collected for a specified number of samples and each sample is collected with a fixed period

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Devices.RepresentationTypes.DISCRETE
member.summary: A data type where each discrete occurrence of the data may have the same value as the previous occurrence of the data. There is no reported state change between occurrences of the data.

member.name: T:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.RequestTypes
member.summary: Options for request paths against a MTConnect Agent.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.RequestTypes.PROBE
member.summary: An Agent responds to a Probe Request with an MTConnectDevices Response Document that contains the Equipment Metadata for pieces of equipment that are requested and currently represented in the Agent.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.RequestTypes.CURRENT
member.summary: An Agent responds to a Current Request with an MTConnectStreams Response Document that contains the current value of Data Entities associated with each piece of Streaming Data available from the Agent, subject to any filtering defined in the Request.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.RequestTypes.SAMPLE
member.summary: An Agent responds to a Sample Request with an MTConnectStreams Response Document that contains a set of values for Data Entities currently available for Streaming Data from the Agent, subject to any filtering defined in the Request.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.RequestTypes.ASSETS
member.summary: An Agent responds to an Asset Request with an MTConnectAssets Response Document that contains information for MTConnect Assets from the Agent, subject to any filtering defined in the Request.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.RequestTypes.ASSET
member.summary: An Agent responds to an Asset Request with an MTConnectAssets Response Document that contains information for MTConnect Assets from the Agent, subject to any filtering defined in the Request.

member.summary: native code is the proprietary identifier designating a specific alarm, fault or warning code provided by the piece of equipment.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.Attributes.ConditionAttributes.NATIVE_SEVERITY
member.summary: severity information to a client software application if the piece of equipment designates a severity level to a fault.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.Attributes.ConditionAttributes.QUALIFIER
member.summary: additional information regarding a condition state associated with the measured value of a process variable. Condition::qualifier defines whether the condition state represented indicates a measured value that is above or below an expected value of a process variable.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.Attributes.ConditionAttributes.STATISTIC
member.summary: Condition::statistic provides additional information describing the meaning of the Condition entity. Condition::statistic MUST match the DataItem::statistic defined in the MTConnectDevices Response Document.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.Attributes.ConditionAttributes.CONDITION_ID
member.summary: identifier of an individual condition activation provided by a piece of equipment. Condition::conditionId MUST be unique for all concurrent condition activation. Condition::conditionId MUST be maintained for all state transitions related to the same condition activation. Multiple Condition::conditionIds MAY exist for the same Condition::nativeCode. If Condition::conditionId is not given, the value is the Condition::nativeCode. If Condition::nativeCode and Condition::conditionId are not given, Condition::conditionId MUST be generated.

member.name: T:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.ControllerModeValues
member.summary: View in the MTConnect Model browser model.mtconnect.org

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.ControllerModeValues.AUTOMATIC
member.summary: Controller is configured to automatically execute a program.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.ControllerModeValues.MANUAL
member.summary: Controller is not executing an active program. It is capable of receiving instructions from an external source – typically an operator. The Controller executes operations based on the instructions received from the external source.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.ControllerModeValues.MANUAL_DATA_INPUT
member.summary: operator can enter a series of operations for the Controller to perform. The Controller will execute this specific series of operations and then stop.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.ControllerModeValues.SEMI_AUTOMATIC
member.summary: Controller is operating in a mode that restricts the active program from processing its next process step without operator intervention.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.ControllerModeValues.EDIT
member.summary: Controller is currently functioning as a programming device and is not capable of executing an active program.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.ControllerModeValues.FEED_HOLD
member.summary: axes of the device are commanded to stop, but the spindle continues to function.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.Elements.ConditionElements.Normal
member.summary: The item being monitored is operating normally and no action is required. Normal also 420 indicates a Fault has been cleared if the item was previously identified with Fault.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.Elements.ConditionElements.Warning
member.summary: The item being monitored is moving into the abnormal range and should be observed. No 423 action is required at this time.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.Elements.ConditionElements.Fault
member.summary: The item has failed and intervention is required to return to a normal condition. 426 Transition to a normal condition indicates that the Fault has been cleared. A fault is 427 something that always needs to be acknowledged before operation can continue. Faults 428 are sometimes noted as an alarm.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.Elements.ConditionElements.Unavailable
member.summary: The condition is in an indeterminate state since the data source is no longer providing 431 data. This will also be the initial state of the condition before a connection is established 432 with the data source. The condition MUST be Unavailable when the value is 433 unknown.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.ExecutionValues.READY
member.summary: Component is ready to execute instructions. It is currently idle.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.ExecutionValues.ACTIVE
member.summary: Component is actively executing an instruction.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.ExecutionValues.INTERRUPTED
member.summary: Component suspends the execution of the program due to an external signal. Action is required to resume execution.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.ExecutionValues.FEED_HOLD
member.summary: motion of the active axes are commanded to stop at their current position.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.ExecutionValues.STOPPED
member.summary: Component program is not READY to execute.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.ExecutionValues.OPTIONAL_STOP
member.summary: command from the program has intentionally interrupted execution. The Component MAY have another state that indicates if the execution is interrupted or the execution ignores the interrupt instruction.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.ExecutionValues.PROGRAM_STOPPED
member.summary: command from the program has intentionally interrupted execution. Action is required to resume execution.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.ExecutionValues.PROGRAM_COMPLETED
member.summary: program completed execution.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.ExecutionValues.WAIT
member.summary: Component suspends execution while a secondary operation executes. Execution resumes automatically once the secondary operation completes.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.ExecutionValues.PROGRAM_OPTIONAL_STOP
member.summary: program has been intentionally optionally stopped using an M01 or similar code. DEPRECATED in version 1.4s and replaced with OPTIONAL_STOP.

member.summary: Used for production processes.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.FileStateValues.REVISION

member.name: T:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.FunctionalModeValues
member.summary: View in the MTConnect Model browser model.mtconnect.org

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.FunctionalModeValues.PRODUCTION
member.summary: Component is currently producing product, ready to produce product, or its current intended use is to be producing product.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.FunctionalModeValues.SETUP
member.summary: Component is not currently producing product. It is being prepared or modified to begin production of product.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.FunctionalModeValues.TEARDOWN
member.summary: Component is not currently producing product. Typically, it has completed the production of a product and is being modified or returned to a neutral state such that it may then be prepared to begin production of a different product.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.FunctionalModeValues.MAINTENANCE
member.summary: Component is not currently producing product. It is currently being repaired, waiting to be repaired, or has not yet been returned to a normal production status after maintenance has been performed.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.FunctionalModeValues.PROCESS_DEVELOPMENT
member.summary: Component is being used to prove-out a new process, testing of equipment or processes, or any other active use that does not result in the production of product.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.OperatingModeValues.AUTOMATIC
member.summary: automatically execute instructions from a recipe or program. > Note: Setpoint comes from a recipe.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.OperatingModeValues.MANUAL
member.summary: execute instructions from an external agent or person. > Note 1 to entry: Valve or switch is manipulated by an agent/person. > Note 2 to entry: Direct control of the PID output. % of the range: A user manually sets the % output, not the setpoint.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.OperatingModeValues.SEMI_AUTOMATIC
member.summary: executes a single instruction from a recipe or program. > Note 1 to entry: Setpoint is entered and fixed, but the PID is controlling. > Note 2 to entry: Still goes through the PID control system. > Note 3 to entry: Manual fixed entry from a recipe.

member.summary: View in the MTConnect Model browser model.mtconnect.org

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.PartProcessingStateValues.NEEDS_PROCESSING
member.summary: part occurrence is not actively being processed, but the processing has not ended. Processing requirements exist that have not yet been fulfilled. This is the default entry state when the part occurrence is originally received. In some cases, the part occurrence may return to this state while it waits for additional processing to be performed.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.PartProcessingStateValues.IN_PROCESS
member.summary: part occurrence is actively being processed.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.PartProcessingStateValues.PROCESSING_ENDED
member.summary: part occurrence is no longer being processed. A general state when the reason for termination is unknown.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.PartProcessingStateValues.PROCESSING_ENDED_COMPLETE
member.summary: part occurrence has completed processing successfully.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.PartProcessingStateValues.PROCESSING_ENDED_STOPPED
member.summary: process has been stopped during the processing. The part occurrence will require special treatment.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.PartProcessingStateValues.PROCESSING_ENDED_ABORTED
member.summary: processing of the part occurrence has come to a premature end.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.PartProcessingStateValues.PROCESSING_ENDED_LOST
member.summary: terminal state when the part occurrence has been removed from the equipment by an external entity and it no longer exists at the equipment.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.PartProcessingStateValues.PROCESSING_ENDED_SKIPPED
member.summary: part occurrence has been skipped for processing on the piece of equipment.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.PartProcessingStateValues.PROCESSING_ENDED_REJECTED
member.summary: part occurrence has been processed completely. However, the processing may have a problem.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.PartProcessingStateValues.WAITING_FOR_TRANSIT
member.summary: part occurrence is waiting for transit.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.PartProcessingStateValues.IN_TRANSIT
member.summary: part occurrence is being transported to its destination.

member.name: F:MtconnectCore.Standard.Contracts.Enums.Streams.PartProcessingStateValues.TRANSIT_COMPLETE
member.summary: part occurrence has been placed at its designated destination.

member.name: P:MtconnectCore.Standard.SampleRequestQuery.Path
member.summary: An XPath that defines specific information or a set of information to be included in an MTConnectStreams Response Document. See Part 1 Section 8.3.3.2 of MTConnect specification.

member.name: P:MtconnectCore.Standard.SampleRequestQuery.From
member.summary: The from parameter designates the sequence number of the first observation in the buffer the Agent MUST consider publishing in the Response Document. See Part 1 Section 8.3.3.2 of MTConnect specification.

member.name: P:MtconnectCore.Standard.SampleRequestQuery.Interval
member.summary: The Agent MUST continuously publish Response Documents when the query parameters include interval using the value as the minimum period between adjacent publications. See Part 1 Section 8.3.3.2 of MTConnect specification.

member.name: P:MtconnectCore.Standard.SampleRequestQuery.Count
member.summary: The count parameter designates the maximum number of observations the Agent MUST publish in the Response Document. See Part 1 Section 8.3.3.2 of MTConnect specification.

member.name: P:MtconnectCore.Standard.SampleRequestQuery.Heartbeat
member.summary: Sets the time period for the heartbeat function in an Agent. The value for heartbeat represents the amount of time after a Response Document has been published until a new Response Document MUST be published, even when no new data is available. See Part 1 Section 8.3.3.2 of MTConnect specification.
